abstract_summ: Methods: We used outbreak data from clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China to estimate the generation interval from symptom onset data while acknowledging uncertainty about the incubation period distribution and the underlying transmission network.METHODS: We used outbreak data from clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China to estimate the generation interval from symptom onset data while acknowledging uncertainty about the incubation period distribution and the underlying transmission network.Conclusions: Estimated serial intervals are shorter than incubation periods in both Singapore and Tianjin, suggesting that pre-symptomatic transmission is occurring.We collated contact tracing data from COVID-19 clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China and estimated the extent of pre-symptomatic transmission by estimating incubation periods and serial intervals.We determine the incubation period and serial interval distribution for transmission clusters in Singapore and in Tianjin.
title_summ: Estimation of the incubation period of COVID-19 using viral load dataIncubation Period and Reproduction Number for novel coronavirus (COVID-19) infections in IndiaTransmission onset distribution of COVID-19 in South KoreaTransmission interval estimates suggest pre-symptomatic spread of COVID-19Estimating the generation interval for COVID-19 based on symptom onset dataEstimation of the incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 in VietnamEstimating pre-symptomatic transmission of COVID-19: a secondary analysis using published dataEstimating the generation interval for coronavirus disease (COVID-19) based on symptom onset data, March 2020Evidence for transmission of COVID-19 prior to symptom onset.
title_abstract_phrases: Methods: We used outbreak data from clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China to estimate the generation interval from symptom onset data while acknowledging uncertainty about the incubation period distribution and the underlying transmission network.METHODS: We used outbreak data from clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China to estimate the generation interval from symptom onset data while acknowledging uncertainty about the incubation period distribution and the underlying transmission network.Conclusions: Estimated serial intervals are shorter than incubation periods in both Singapore and Tianjin, suggesting that pre-symptomatic transmission is occurring.We collated contact tracing data from COVID-19 clusters in Singapore and Tianjin, China and estimated the extent of pre-symptomatic transmission by estimating incubation periods and serial intervals.Interpretation Considering the transmission onset distribution peaked with the symptom onset and the pre-symptomatic transmission proportion is substantial, the usual preventive measure might be too late to prevent SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
